revised_title: Exploring the Three-Dimensional Structure of Rotating Sound Fields
tldr: The author presents an exact analysis of rotating sound fields, focusing on the three-dimensional structure of the sound field produced by a spinning sinusoidal distribution of thickness or loading sources. The study investigates the dependence of the structure on three parameters: type of acoustic source, tip Mach number, and harmonic number. The results reveal the boundary between near-field and far-field structure, which is well-defined and occupies the surface of a sphere or ellipsoid.
